Data Loader (load_data.py)

load_data.py

Loads cleaned and LLM-extended applicant data into the PostgreSQL applicants table.

Public API (used by app.py and tests)

load_rows(rows, conn)

Insert rows (list of dicts) into the database using the supplied psycopg connection. The connection is not closed by this function.

Idempotency: rows are upserted on the unique constraint (comments, date_added, url) so that re-running the loader with identical data produces no duplicates.

main()

CLI entry point: reads the JSON file and calls load_rows.

Parsing helpers are module-level so they can be imported and unit-tested.

load_data.extract_degree(text)[source]

Infer degree type from text.

Returns:

"PhD", "Masters", or None.

load_data.extract_gre_parts(text)[source]

Extract GRE total, verbal, and AW scores from text.

Returns:

Tuple (gre_total, gre_verbal, gre_aw) — each float or None.

load_data.extract_nationality(text)[source]

Infer nationality classification from free-text text.

Returns:

"International", "American", or None.

load_data.extract_program_from_notes(text)[source]

Return the second |-delimited segment of text (program name).

load_data.extract_status_from_notes(text)[source]

Detect decision status keyword from text.

Returns:

"Accepted", "Rejected", "Waitlisted", or None.

load_data.extract_term(text)[source]

Extract academic term (Fall/Spring/Summer + 4-digit year) from text.

Returns:

str like "Fall 2026" or None.

load_data.extract_university_from_notes(text)[source]

Return the first |-delimited segment of text (university name).

load_data.load_rows(rows, conn)[source]

Insert rows into the applicants table using conn.

Each element of rows is a dict with the same keys produced by the Module 2 scraper / LLM pipeline.

Idempotency is enforced via ON CONFLICT DO NOTHING on the unique constraint (comments, date_added, url).

Parameters:

  • rows (list[dict]) – Raw applicant dicts from the scraper.

  • conn – Active psycopg connection. The caller is responsible for closing / committing it.

Returns:

Number of rows actually inserted (conflicts excluded).

Return type:

int

load_data.main(input_json=None, database_url=None)[source]

CLI entry point. Reads a JSON file and loads it into the database.

Parameters:

  • input_json (str|None) – Path to the JSON file. Defaults to the Module 2 output file relative to this script.

  • database_url (str|None) – libpq connection string. Defaults to the DATABASE_URL environment variable.

load_data.parse_date(value)[source]

Parse value string into a datetime.date.

Tries multiple common formats; returns None if none match.

load_data.parse_float(value)[source]

Safely convert value to float.

Returns:

float or None.

load_data.split_notes(text)[source]

Split text on | and return non-empty, stripped segments.
